ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 122
ygData.msgSnippet: its amazing how bent some of you get over spending 34 cents a day on a game... hell i loose more change then that over the course of one day... play the game
ygData.messageBody:
its amazing how bent some of you get over spending 34 cents a day on a
game... hell i loose more change then that over the course of one day...
play the game or dont play the game, nobody cares... and by the way, "shit
happens and we adjust" is very logial and, furthermore, one of the most
widely accepted scientific theories (really about the only theory) on why
there are so many different forms of life on this little plant� it's really
about the only way anyone can be a success in life. If one cant live by the
motto, �shit happens and we adjust� you will be going they way of the
dinosaur before too long�

'till then...

that which was Quaan





>From: "Greg" <greg@...>
>Reply-To: EQ-Monks@onelist.com
>To: <EQ-Monks@onelist.com>
>Subject: Re: [EQ-Monks] Digest Number 122
>Date: Sat, 18 Dec 1999 13:29:58 -0500
>
>
> Hmm. "Shit happens and we adjust"
>
> I don't see that as being very logical
>
> Verant is giving us bullshit and we are paying them for it.
>
> And this is a game. "Shit" shouldn't happen and you shouldn't have to
>"Adjust" (I.E. Sitting back timidly and watching your enjoyment being
>lessened and doing nothign about it but scowling occaisionally at the ones
>responsible). It should be enjoyed. But, I know it is addictive. Verant
>COUNTS on the fact that they can screw over this game to their vision of an
>ideal game and keep you playing at the same time, only because you are too
>addicted to do more then complain and bitch and put down other complainers
>and bitchers. I've quit EQ, but I can't help look at all this and laugh.
>It's funny. Seriously.
>
> I don't like playing a game where I have to do any MAJOR
>"Adjustments".
>
> Hell, Origin's only fault, and their fatal fault, was the fact that
>they
>screwed their customers over individually with corrupt game masters and
>peice-a-crap customer support. But they never mauled their game as
>terribly
>as Verant is doing to EQ.
>
> I would still love this game and play it if it werent for some of the
>things they've done. But I can't do anything about it but leave. Im not
>letting them have my 10$ a month, and if some of you are so beat up about
>this game, seriously, take a look at the broad range of where it's heading
>and whats happening to it. Do you see a pattern in the "Tunings" verant is
>making? Take a big broad look at it all, and say to yourself "Do I still
>like this game?" "Is it still worth it?" "Should I support this company
>with my money any longer?" If you do still like it, I congratulate you:
>You're damn good at taking huge amounts of shit from others to try to enjoy
>something.
>
> Your decisions are your own, but sometimes it's good to take a good
>step
>back and look at the big picture, and take a look where it's going, and
>decide whether you want to go the same way or not.
>
> I agree with one thing though, that if some of you people seriously
>think
>of Everwhack as more than a game... You should see some help, or something
>like that.
>
>--
>Darkblade
>
>
>----- Original Message -----
>From: Dave Gaines <dave@...>
>To: <EQ-Monks@onelist.com>
>Sent: Thursday, December 16, 1999 1:28 PM
>Subject: Re: [EQ-Monks] Digest Number 122
>
>
> > From: Dave Gaines <dave@...>
> >
> > Brother, Neighbor, college friend, someone in pasadina you don't even
> > know... Its a game. You happen to play with your brother, that's
> > wonderful, however EQ is still a game. For you, the ability to
> > play a game together means you can spend time together. That
> > is wonderful. This doesn't make EQ more than a game. EQ didn't exist
> > 9 months ago, at some date in the future, EQ will not exist. I hope
> > you have a contingency plan ready, because EQ is not life, or a way of
> > life, it is simply a game you enjoy together. Joke all you want that
> > it is life, fine, no problem. But when you read a post where someone
> > seriously thinks it is more than a game. Please step back from it
> > and think about it.
> >
> > IF EQ was perfect, or something you've been doing for tens of years
> > and nothing had ever changed on it, then you would have a much better
> > argument. However we can clearly see that monks aren't being singled
> > out, almost every class is being tuned every month. This one was
> > slightly major.
> >
> > But enough is enough. Shit happens and we adjust. This mailing list
> > is not about these kinds of posts or this kind of thread.
> >
> > The purpose of this list is to distribute information about Monks to the
>players of EverQuest. Spoilers may be included so read at your own risk.
> >
> > The purpose of this list is NOT to be a vent for your fustration.
> >
>
>
><< text3.html >>
